Viewing (Executing) Saved Reports

When you click VIEW for a saved report, the report definition associated with the saved report will begin executing. When the saved report executes, you are in read-only mode, and you will not be able to modify the report definition from this screen. However, the executed reports themselves are still interactive.

You can still drill into the reports, filter metric ranges, filter column rows, sort the columns in the results grid, adjust the number of rows shown in the chart, show and hide the grid and/or chart, and export the results. However, you cannot modify the visualization displayed when you are viewing a saved report – this must be changed from the Builder screen.

Note that while the report definition is not visible in the same way as in the Report Builder screen, the filters applied to the selected columns are visible to give you full context into the report displayed on the screen.

It is important to keep in mind that any range based filters, column based filters, column sorting, and row number selection applied to a report or booklet in the Reports and Booklets page do not persist; they are simply visual changes that cannot be saved to the report you are viewing and are discarded when you perform any other action or navigate away from the page.
